PROPIVERINE HYDROCHLORIDE

ANTIMUSCARINICS (SYSTEMIC)

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Prescribing and dispensing
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Urinary frequency, urgency and incontinence associated with overactive bladder,

By mouth using modified-release capsules

  • For adults
    15 mg 1–2 times a day, increased if necessary up to 15 mg 3 times a day.
  • For adults
    30 mg once daily.

Urinary frequency, urgency and incontinence associated with neurogenic bladder instability,

By mouth using immediate-release medicines

  • For adults
    15 mg 3 times a day.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises avoid (restriction of skeletal development in animals).

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Avoid in moderate to severe impairment.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Max. daily dose 30 mg if eGFR less than 30 mL/minute/1.73m2.

Manufacturer advises caution in mild or moderate impairment.

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

The need for continuing therapy for urinary incontinence should be reviewed every 4–6 weeks until symptoms stabilise, and then every 6–12 months.

Prepared medicinal forms of PROPIVERINE HYDROCHLORIDE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Tablet
Modified-release capsule
